page.title: 14Churches
page.content: {St Agatha's Church} is the main Anglican Church in Brightwell cum Sotwell, and records date back to 854 and an early Saxon Charter. The first recorded Rector was in 1260. The Rector in 1985 is Rev. R. Hayne, who has lived and worked in the village for 8yrs. {St.James, Sotwell} was rebuilt in 1884, but the origins can be traced back to 1158. It shares the Rector with St. Agatha's. It is a delightful church and is well worth a visit. {Free Church} The Sotwell Free Church celebrated its centenary in 1985. Its present Pastor is the Rev. Adrian Brooks who has been there for 9 years. He takes two main services on Sundays and there are prayer meetings or house meetings on Wednesdays. The Free Church was started by Agusta Fairthorne.
